activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A Gullens

defendant.name: Gullens, Jason A

records.addlTxt: To the Clerk of Court Office

Phone contact only with KM and children; during those calls that may be no violent or abusive behavior. 

****While in custody the defendant may have in person visits that will be supervised by the jail.

9:26 AM 2021CM000069, 2021CM000094, 2021CM000115, 2021CM000147, 2022CF000083 -  Defendant Jason A Gullens in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Yang in court for Jason A Gullens.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.

22CF83:  Attorney Yang has provided the court with a waiver of preliminary in 22CF83. Court goes over the preliminary hearing form. Court binds over for trial. Attorney Forehand states that she will be bring forth the same charges that are listed on the criminal complaint. Attorney Yang waives the formal reading. Max penalties stated. Attorney Yang stands mute on behalf of his client.

Attorney Yang speaks about the bond and asks for a reduction of bond to $2,000. Attorney Forehand objects to amending the cash bond and explains why. Attorney Yang speaks about some details that were stated.  Court denies bond modification.

Victim speaks about the no contact and asks for JG be able to speaks with his kids. Attorney Forehand doesn't object with no contact with the children 
Court will amend any bonds that have the no contact listed with KM and the children to allow phone contact only and during those calls that may be no violent or abusive behavior. While in custody the defendant may have in person visits that will be supervised by the jail.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
11:33 AM Defendant Jason A Gullens appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Yang in court for Jason A Gullens.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. CC Angel vacate the warrant. Attorney Forehand asks for a 10,000 cash bond with a condition of no contact with the victim and not to commit any new crimes while on bond. Attorney Yang object to a $10,000 cash bond and asks for $1,000 cash. Attorney Forehand comments. 

CC Angel orders:
$10,000 cash bond
No contact with KM.

CC Angel speaks about the initial appearance. Attorney Yang waives the formal reading of the complaint. Max penalties stated. Attorney Yang enters a NG plea in the CM and waives the time limits to a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Return on warrant on October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:10 PM 2021CM000094, 2021CM000115, 2021CM000147, 2022CF00083 -  Attorney Michael Yang appeared by video for Jason A Gullens. State appears by Attorney Harper. Attorney Yang doesn't know where his client is. Attorney Harper asks for a warrant. Court orders a warrant on all cases.
